website_summaries.verdict: Belt attachment that includes a swivel to give the dog the ability to safely move around a little bit.
pros: Lightweight device, but it delivers a better level of protection than you might think
Works nicely for dogs who have a hard time sitting still
Uses a carabiner to simplify the process of hooking the dog to the belt
cons: Must purchase a harness or additional restraint separately

customer_reviews.title: Seatbelt saved my dog's life
customer_reviews.text: Was in a car accident yesterday on I-4 outside of Tampa. All cars were stopped and this guy was speeding and did not stopped. He hit us and we flew into the median. Luckily, everyone was wearing a seatbelt, including our dog. We have this seatbelt for my 30 lb puppy. I can honestly say this saved her from getting hurt. Can't imagine what would have happened if she wasn't wearing it. I can honestly say this product works since I just went through a car wreck with my dog strapped in. My dog is completely fine today. Highly recommend this product. Have two of these for both cars. Remember to always buckle up your pet!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: My puppy pulled it free, jumped out of car window
customer_reviews.text: This is probably a fine product for a dog who is so weak/small it stands no chance, but for ANY semi-athletic or excitable dog (boxer, retriever, lab, hound, german shepherd, etc) I strongly advise against this. My 5-month-old puppy (black lab/german shepherd mix) had enough strength to yank this seat belt out of the buckle (yes, it was solidly "clicked" in). I had the back windows down halfway to keep him occupied, and he quickly jumped out into an intersection for me to chase him down.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L. Sharpe

customer_reviews.title: Strong and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I'd previous purchased a kurgo set consisting of a car harness and seatbelt tether. Everything was great until I started back at work and accidentally took the tether with me on a day my husband would be driving our dog. I then bought this tether to just keep in his car so that whichever of us had her would be able to buckle her in for rides. It seems strong, and it's very easy to use. Unlike other models it can be used in any car because it doesn't rely on the seatbelt receiver to work.
customer_reviews.author: leighstew

customer_reviews.title: I love knowing my dog wears a seat belt just like me!
customer_reviews.text: Very cute safety belt for my dog. Every dog owner should buy one of these and keep it in your vehicle. This is a smart device to buy if you travel with your pet and have their safely in mind. It is not so restrictive that she can’t move around a bit or so loose she can wander around. It does have some adjustability. I’m so glad I got her one and tell everyone who loves taking their dog with them to get one. The price is great too!
customer_reviews.author: P. Berry

customer_reviews.title: The carabiner clip fails
customer_reviews.text: The strap is great and this is easy to use. This is definitely a solid choice for those whose dogs cannot tolerate being tethered directly to the human seatbelt (like mine) as some dog harnesses seem to be designed for. My only concern is the possible failure of the carabiner clip, as whatever spring mechanism responsible for opening and closing the carabiner has definitely failed on mine and with only a short time of use.
customer_reviews.author: Spudly

customer_reviews.title: uh-oh unbuckles
customer_reviews.text: Loved this tether and used it for about a week. Then one day I looked back and my pup was marching back and forth completely free. I saw that her movement had pulled the belt latch up through the protective seat cover and figured she must have stepped on the release. After this happened a few more times in two months, I had to stop using it. Now she rides in her crate.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: One suggestion
customer_reviews.text: Product works great and I actually use mine as a handing lead going go and from the car. The only issue I've found is that the dogs can accidently press the red release button on the seatbelt, which releases this harness. I'm still working on a good solution but if a plastic or rubber sleeve/cap was included to cover the release button, this product would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: halligan1201

customer_reviews.title: Just What I need for a strong stubborn dog.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves to be on my armrest in the car and lick me while driving. That tickles and could cause me to get distracted while traveling. This kit is great for a very strong Lab/Pit mixed 2 y.o. puppy. Make sure the areas that you will attach to in your vehicle are sturdy and secure because it could be a possibility that the tether will loosen. The leash is great in order to restrain the dog from accessing something they shouldn't by making the leash shorter.
customer_reviews.author: KR Washington

customer_reviews.title: QA on carabiners
customer_reviews.text: My dog's safety is very important to me, but their carabiners are nothing but trash. The carabiner has failed on me and the gate just sticks, after a week it failed. It lost its springy feel and would either open or close depending on its orientation. I upgraded to a climbing carabiner and made the best of it. Since its working with a upgraded carabiner, i'll be keeping it because the idea is great and it keeps my dog safe.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Best invention!
customer_reviews.text: This doggie seatbelt buckle barrier is awesome and leaves me at peace! My 50 lb dog is very hyper at the beginning of a car ride and always wants to come upfront with me. The seatbelt definitely keeps him in the back while allowing myself to stay alert on the road. He kept unbuckling himself so I did a quick Google search and found the buckle barrier. This thing is amazing! My dog and I are so happy and worry free while out on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and for a great price! Seat belt goes through the loop of tether and then seat belt is buckled in, and then the clip then clips on to the dog's harness. Because of the length and because of the way it loops around the seat belt my dog still has some room to move around in the back of the car too. Because of the easiness of this product and because of the great price I purchased a second one since I am a Rover dog sitter so if I have two dogs at a time in my car it's such an added feeling of safety which is priceless. Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy F.

customer_reviews.title: Replacement seatbelt tether even sturdier than the one it replaced
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement seatbelt tether for my dog, for use in the car with her Kurgo harness. The clip on the old tether, that hooked onto the D-ring on the harness, broke after about a dozen years. As for most of those years I was fostering rescue dogs, it had been through quite a few dogs of varying sizes, energy levels, and degrees of comfort in the car. So it wasn't fragile, by any means. The replacement tether has a significantly sturdier, stronger, and quite secure carabinier clip which should be able to withstand many more years of use and abuse! I'm delighted.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth Carey

customer_reviews.title: Easily Restricts Movement
customer_reviews.text: We clip together TWO of these devices together, and clip it on the back seat HEADREST post. Then by attaching a carabiner clip, gotten from Walmart, we clip it to the dog's harness. Attaching the strap to the HEADREST post, in the back seat, prevents him from getting tangled in it, if it were at seat level. And he can move around easier in the back. Love them, carry spares with us well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This clicked right into the buckle of my car and the one in my friend's car. These are a Toyota and a Subaru. It is easy to change the length of the tether and the carabiner clicks right into the loop on the collar. Since the carabiner is on a swivel, my dog never gets tangled and can turn around. The tether feels sturdy and looks well-made. I like that my dog can ride shotgun with me in safety, instead of having to sit in the back in a crate.
customer_reviews.author: Peridox

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for freedom to move
customer_reviews.text: Have used the zip line in the cargo area of my Highlander. It sits low along the floor and allows my dog freedom to move everywhere in the space without allowing him to come up between the seats. Really good materials and thoughtful design. Taking the slack out is very easy, and a band is attached to hold the excess after tightening. TIP: The leash is super short. I purchased a Kurgo safety harness (leash included) and a Kurgo swivel tether to keep him from twisting up the leashes. Altogether about 4 feet from zip line to harness, but can be made about a foot shorter with the safety leash.
customer_reviews.author: G-Joe

customer_reviews.title: Really nice Swivel Tether
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy duty swivel and tether. I Jerry rigged a extended tether by joining this one with another to give my dog more room to move about. It worked very well to keep her from getting tangled up. It is very well made of heavy durable material. The clasp has a screw up lock to keep it from coming unsnapped as the dog turns around. If you want a close tether is i great as is. I was going on an extended trip and wanted her to be free to move about and yet restrained in case of sudden stop. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Bert Maddox

customer_reviews.title: Maybe good for non-chewers
customer_reviews.text: It was super easy to install and worked great with our seat belts. Unfortunately, my dog chewed through it and then was scrambling loose in the backseat while I was going down the freeway. FUN. This wasn't equipment failure; this was dog shenanigans. HOWEVER, if you know your dog is a chewer, this isn't the product for you. Get the tether made of the same material as a tie-out cable (different brand). That one will keep your dog safe and tethered while on the road. I'd like to give this a higher rating because I actually think the product would work fine for other dogs, but it did fail for us so I can't really recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Efficient and functional
customer_reviews.text: I own two loop tethers, seatbelt tethers, & a zipline and love them all. So far, all have held up to Mini Schnauzer puppy teeth well. Products are heavy duty, & feel similar to the webbing and biners we use for climbing purposes (though I wouldn’t count on them being a substitute). I own several Kurgo products and love the look and functionality of all of them. Have not had any durability issues (ripping or fraying) like some have reported - over two generations of small-medium sized dogs. Use the zip line and tethers with the Kurgo True Fit Harnesses (built in rear attachment loop) and they work great!
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: Product idea is great but materials are not durable enough
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept of this product and it would help keep a dog from unclipping a lead that plugs into a seatbelt fitting. However, the plastic definitely doesn't hold up to a young dog. My 7 month old Doberman puppy destroyed the fitting during a 15 minute car ride. He started out chewing on his bone and decided to switch over to the protector. I'd be more likely to buy this again if you could get it in stainless steel. Anything that would be safe and stand up to the teeth of a determined chewer.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. Muntz

customer_reviews.title: Secure backseat dog tether
customer_reviews.text: This is my third try finding secure tethers for my two dogs in the back seat. Though they are only 16 lbs. each there is always one that feels rambunctious and can seem like they are bigger. The carabinger clip is ample and the other end fits directly into the seatbelt buckles rather than around the strap thus their movements are restricted which is much safer for all of us. The straps are adjustable so can custom fit each dog.
customer_reviews.author: Hebe Martin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and use
customer_reviews.text: Dogs need to be confined in some manner while in the car. My dog is claustrophobic so a crate is not possible. I have a safety harness that has a tether to the seatbelt but I was tired of moving the tether between cars. Bought this one and love it. Simple latch it into any seatbelt clip and then I attach the 'carabiner' ring to the harness on my dog. Could NOT be easier to use, unless my dog could buckle herself in on her own!
customer_reviews.author: Janice B.

customer_reviews.title: Crash Tested Gives Peace of Mind
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Kurgo Tru Fit Smart Harness because it had been crash tested. Not many other harnesses meant for the car do this and I find that the structure and strength of the tether (& harness) shows. We lost the tether that came with the harness, so I was happy to see it's sold on its own for the same price as Kurgo lists. I researched other non-crash tested harness/tether systems and this seemed the best option and it's worked well for us.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: They have cheaper better option.
customer_reviews.text: Love the look and the swivel clip is probably the best. Most seatbelt clips are bulky, this one isn't. But truth be told, they have better, safer option, cheaper option. The hard rubber thing that keeps the belt neat is easily breakable and big, my little puppy swallowed the whole thing. That's a terrible oversight on Kurgo. I've switched to a seat belt tether that has a rubber band inside it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe A

customer_reviews.title: The Kurgo swivel is priceless; no more tangled tether in the car seat!
customer_reviews.text: My pup likes to turn around in his (Solvit) car seat to look out all the windows in the car. The (Solvit) tether was getting so twisted it was looking frayed, and it was a big hassle to untangle it each time. I got a Kurgo dog harness (comes with a short tether) and this Kurgo swivel tether, and installed both tethers linked together in the (Solvit) car seat, and they work really well. My dog can twirl around all he wants, and the Kurgo swivel tether never gets tangled up. It's fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: An observer

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Wish it was a tad longer for our purposes, but we are very satisfied with the quality of this product. Metal latches, and sturdy mesh material. Clicks really nice to the seat-belt lock. My corgi does un-click himself in the backseat on occasion, its hard to tell when he is not clicked in, but that's not this products fault, ill have to 3D print something to prevent that.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I love that the attachment to the zip line is fully adjustable so that I can keep my dog secure. The line that attaches to a harness also doubles as a leash!! Super convenient! I have a Jeep Wrangler so when we have the top off I was worried about my dog falling out but with this he is completely secure. Instead of attaching it to the seatbelts I attached to my roll bars and it worked great! This is very well made and a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: Great idea just not for my dog
customer_reviews.text: This was extremely easy to use and convenient. That being said, my dog was very easily able to turn around and chew right through the strap. Got to use it for less than a day. I don't know if that's a problem that can even be fixed in making them more durable. But I will say it is not a cheaply made product. It is well made, of good quality, and very easy to use. It just did not work for my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Ward

customer_reviews.title: Good product but too short for big dogs
customer_reviews.text: It look good, and has good quality! However, i does not fit my dog. My dog was a 70 lbs Samoyed and even after I adjusted the seat belt to the max length, it still too tight for my dog. I do not blame on this product. If you do not have a big size dog, and your dog is not that crazy active, this seat belt would be perfect. I have to return it and buy a longer one.
customer_reviews.author: Ke Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my 10 lb dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog does not like the car and HATED being in a crate in the car. This is a much better compromise- I put the harness on and clip this on her and "buckle" her in the back seat. She is safe so I am happy, and although she still doesn't like the car, it is 100 times better than the crate. There is no way she would be able to unbuckle herself either, this thing is sturdy. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie DiBona

customer_reviews.title: Driving safe
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough of good things about this harness. Safety is number 1 while driving. It allows me to not have to crate my dog every time I go somewhere. It snaps right into your car seat belt. It's strong, sturdy. The metal on this is heavy duty. It's so so simple to use. I keep it in the side pocket of my door.
customer_reviews.author: Momma Clem

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT in Jeep Grand Cherokee
customer_reviews.text: This seat belt buckles firmly in to three of the four passenger seats in the 2014 and 2015 Jeep Grand Cherokee. It does not work in the middle back passenger belt buckle. The carabiner is pretty thick. Our dog's harness has a pretty small metal loop for leash clips, so this buckle is a little cumbersome to attach to her harness. Obviously, though, it is worth the small hassle to keep our pup secure in the back or passenger seats.
customer_reviews.author: Cat B

customer_reviews.title: If you like to drive with your dog.. You need this!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I bought this lifesaver!! My Dog did so well with this!!, We had the best road trip knowing that he was safe. This device is made with 100% safety and it shows! I originally thought I might try to make one of my own, but when you get this and see the quality, you will be relieved they did all the thinking for us. I am thrilled with this! We had a great trip and I felt like a good dog mom knowing he would be safe in the event of an accident.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne Schneider

customer_reviews.title: great for big dogs
customer_reviews.text: my GSD is 88 pounds and would jump around in the back seat . this keeps her in place only thing I would say to do is take a piece rope and tie it to the child seat loop in your seat and into the part that clips into the seat belt in case as your dog jumps a run they may step on the seat belt release
customer_reviews.author: craig cmiller

customer_reviews.title: Seems well made, but doesn't fit either of the late model cars we own. Both Toyotas
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made, but doesn't fit either of the late model cars we own. On one (2014 Toyota Corolla) the seat belt will not fasten with this yellow guard in place. On the other the seat belt clip ins are up against a console (2017 Toyota Tacoma) and it's almost impossible to release the seat belt once it's fastened if the guard is in place
customer_reviews.author: Liazard

customer_reviews.title: GENIUS!
customer_reviews.text: This is genius! Clip one end to the harness and the other to the seat belt - done. I have 2 large dogs: The puppy likes to sit when she rides and this helps keep her safe; The old man gets the zoomies every time the car stops and this helps keep me and the puppy and everyone else on the road safe. You can get similar products for less money. I'm a satisfied Kurgo customer, though. And I think their lifetime warranty may offset any up-front savings you'd get with a cheaper product.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: so it would be nice to adjust the leash length in such a way ...
customer_reviews.text: The zipline has worked very well for us no matter what vehicle we use it in. Our dog doesn't get tangled up in it. My only suggestion to Kurgo (which is minor) is to include some kind of clip or band for adjust the length of the leash. Some cars are taller and others are shorter, so it would be nice to adjust the leash length in such a way that the leash doesn't have a lot of "extra" flopping around. Otherwise, this is a well-designed product.
customer_reviews.author: Traveling Dog-Lover

customer_reviews.title: Not for large dogs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to keep my greyhound from turning into a projectile. She wears a harness. This belt is not long enough, even when pulled to its full length, to clip to the top of her harness. Had to clip the belt to the bottom of her harness which resulted in her twisting it around her feet.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra L Talarico

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy car tether
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace a tether that came with my dog’s car seat that had worn out. This one is much sturdier and more well-made than his precious tether and I feel much more comfortable using this one as I am not worried it is going to break or that the stitching will come lose (my dog gets anxious in the car and pulls and spins around in his seat). Only reason I gave it 4 stars is because, when my dog paces in his seat, it gets all twisted up and gets so tight he gets pinned in place and I have to pull over to un-twist him. I wish it had the ability to twist 360 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Keeps pets safe & comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Easy to use, allows safe range of motion for car trips. One dog is anxious, another is too curious- this is a perfect solution for both of them. No worries about lunging within the vehicle or getting too far out the window. Safely allows pets to be tethered.
customer_reviews.author: S. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: We needed something to secure our poodle, Maggie, to the back seat of our Jeep. She rides around a lot with us, and we were worried she might one day jump out and end up falling. So far, we love this seatbelt! It lengthens just long enough so she can still get her head out of the window and into the wind like she loves to do, all while it is securely buckled in. The only thing I wish was different is how light the D ring portion is. I would have liked it to seem a bit heavier. All in all, a good buy and I am glad we bought this!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Tacey

customer_reviews.title: Peace of Mind Convenience
customer_reviews.text: Having the belt permanently in the back seat means I always attach the dog and know that she will be safe in case of abrupt stops and also not be able to rummage around in the car when I do short errands leaving her. Four stars to alert others that getting the belt to securely fasten in the female seat belt took extra care. The first time I took her out, it came loose because I had not seated it and then checked by pulling strongly. Overall, a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I have a dog that is always trying to get away. If a door is opened, she bolts and you cannot catch her. With this, I know she is safe and secure and not jumping into the front seat. What a great device. I also have a Kurgo car seat and it is a good match. Very good products
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ONE STAR
customer_reviews.text: I originally wrote a great review. BUT NOW WHEN I NEEDED THIS DEVICE IT BENT AT THE SEAT BELT BUCKLE AND I COULD NOT UNBUCKLE MY DOG. I DO NOT US IT AT ALL. THE PART THAT GOES INTO THE BUCKLE IS SO THIN YOU CAN BEND IT. IF THEY CAN MAKE IT A THICKER GAUGE SEAT BELT CLIP. MAY BE I WOULD CHANGE MY RATING.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Young

customer_reviews.title: Great Zipline
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mother in-law's car so that she can feel safe taking the dog for a ride. Was easy to set up and is of great quality. Came quickly and as described. Were both very happy with the purchase, I'm actually considering ordering one for my car.
customer_reviews.author: Angelshorty021

customer_reviews.title: great except for one thing
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, sturdy, adjustable. On my vehicle, my dog can step on the seat buckle release, which releases the strap and results in a failure to secure my dog. I also have a Kurgo Harness that came with a strap that goes around the belts. My dog can not accidentally release himself with this strap. Kurgo makes a great product, it just doesn't work with my dog and car.
customer_reviews.author: Trailspike

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Used it for two dogs on a cross country trip and had no issues! Very convenient, and gave us the piece of mind we needed when making lots of stops in unknown places. Keeps the dogs from being able to jump out of the car when you open the door, also keeps them from jumping into the front seat. can't say enough good things about the product. Would certainly NOT recommend attaching it to the seat belts as shown in the picture. Best places to attach it to is either the baby car seat attachments located in between the seats, or any other metal attachment points inside of your vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: K'nATop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not for preventing injuries in an accident.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great way to secure your dog in the car. I would not recommend using this for your dog if your intention is to protect them in an accident. What this is great for securing your dog in the car so he can stay put and not jump out the window. Very well-made and does what it’s supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: DJE87

customer_reviews.title: Safety First
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Seat Belt Tether to go along with a booster pet seat I ordered. I felt the tether that came with the booster seat was not strong and too long which allowed my dog to move around too much in the seat. I was concerned about how far he could be flung in sudden stops. The Kurgo Safety Tether is very strong. I have had to stop suddenly in my car several times and my dog stayed securely within the booster seat. But it is still long enough to allow him to look out the window.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Linda

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a houndini. With his original car tether (DIY chain) he would spin and spin around in the car until the tether got short enough and he'd either get stuck there and cry or magically unhook one of the ends to enjoy freedom. I love the fact that it swivels and doesn't rely on a seatbelt to work like the other swivel connectors if I chose to tether my dog somewhere else. While not advertised, this tether could also make a great traffic leash to keep your dog close.
customer_reviews.author: Tim M

customer_reviews.title: Windows down dog in
customer_reviews.text: Dont know why I didnt buy one sooner. Now I just leave the windows down when I have to run in somewhere or to keep her in the back when I have company sitting in the front. Also keeps the annoying seatbelts sound off when she wants to hang out in the front.
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: This is an extremely well made product but has one inherent design issue. The lead/tether would be near perfect if it had a swivel mechanism. I had to stop often to untangle the lead and will either replace the the lead with a different product or devise my own swivel. Otherwise a very well made product!
customer_reviews.author: Charles J Jelf

customer_reviews.title: No flying pups!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 8 month old Corgi and everytime we go somewhere I attach it to her harness for safety. Because she is smaller, it's still a little long and doesn't keep her in the passenger seat when she tries to crawl in my lap--she gets stuck on the cup holders. It has on multiple occasions kept her from flying in the floor due to a sudden stop! Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Daydreamer

customer_reviews.title: My Dog Says Buy This Tether!
customer_reviews.text: After reading about a pet thrown out of a car in an accident and lost for 3 days I started looking for a restraint for my dog. She is an excellent car rider, settles into the back seat and mostly sleeps but I wanted to protect her. So I found several reviews on the Kurgo products and finally purchased the tether for her. It works like a charm! She doesn't know she is tethered since it is long enough for her to sit up or curl up and sleep. It hooks securely to the seat belt bracket and the D ring is easy to attach to her harness. Recommending this product to all my friends!
customer_reviews.author: artgirl147

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Our dog loves to stick her head out the car windows. This swivel tether, coupled with the zip line, lets our dog have the run of the back seat and gives us peace of mind for her safety. The locking mechanism on the carabiner is brilliant. The lifetime guarantee made this purchase a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Strong. Secure Lock. Swivel.
customer_reviews.text: Very strong. I love how the Carabiner has a screw-able lock to secure. Also, the carabiner attachment swivels, so my dogs don't get tangled when they move around. I hope this doesn't make it any less secure, because we really like it. Downside is that the metal part is a bit heavy, so be careful to prevent it from falling on your dog. If you have very small dogs like mine, you might want to make sure they don't have to carry the weight of the tether on themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Deepa

customer_reviews.title: Keep Your Doggie Safe
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use this strap to keep our large dog safe while traveling. There are several ways to attach it, so there is always one that will work for different vehicles. We ordered the harness as well and use the leash that comes with it since it is shorter than the one that comes with the zipline, but that one also has adjustable lengths. Some reviews suggested a swivel, so we found a heavy-duty one to attach and keep the leash from twisting and it works well. Would highly recommend this restraint to keep your dog safe while in your vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: smist

customer_reviews.title: Good overall
customer_reviews.text: I really like this for convenience and ease of use. Only downside: My dog is able to unbuckle himself by stepping on the seat attachment. It doesnt happen often, but could be a concern if your dog really wants to sit in the drivers lap (like mine). I'm going to keep using it it and like the product overall
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Coverdale

customer_reviews.title: Crash Tested Confidence
customer_reviews.text: We love the Kurgo crash tested harness system. After much research we decided it was the safest way to secure our 45lb very active Aussie. AKC recommends crating your dog when traveling but that is difficult in our vehicle and more importantly it has never been tested that we could find. We belong to and love AKC but crating needs to be tested. Kurgo should be commended for their efforts. After trying it in one vehicle we have now added it to all our vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: kirk gittings

customer_reviews.title: Safely secure
customer_reviews.text: Lifesaver. Literally! My large golden retriever puppy jumped over the seat and threw my gearshift into neutral at an intersection. Just as the light turned green LOL. After installing this she hast to stay right where I put her! Safe and sound
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Puppy showed us he wanted one notch looser
customer_reviews.text: Tested today and it’s the first time my wife has been able to ride in the front seat since we got the puppy because she doesn’t have to worry about our puppy jumping out of the window while we ensure he gets breeze and can see what is around him.
customer_reviews.author: Mike MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Must have for jumpers
customer_reviews.text: Great items for any dog who would rather be in the front seat but needs to remain in the back. My dog is 65 pounds and had unbuckled himself a few times so windows should remain up enough for safety but this helps a lot with his need to jump and distract my driving .
customer_reviews.author: Karnold

customer_reviews.title: Thank you, Kurgo!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice and well made seatbelt for dogs. It buckles properly into the seatbelt of a Nissan Frontier (makes the click sound) and hooks onto the loop of the dog harness. You can adjust it to make it longer or shorter. My dog does not try to escape from it during the ride. Wish I had bought it sooner. Thank you Kurgo for the great product!
customer_reviews.author: A. Kibodeaux

customer_reviews.title: Simple, solid, a great product for dog parents.
customer_reviews.text: For many years I've attached my dog's harness to a buckled in seatbelt with a climbing grade carabineer and a very short leash. This is a definite upgrade. It clips right into the buckle, has an adjustable lead, and a good solid small carabineer to hook to his harness. It does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Matt R.

customer_reviews.title: Border Collie Puppy approved!
customer_reviews.text: Used this on my 6 months old Border Collie for the first time yesterday, I loved it! I think she approved too! First time she's been in the car without a crate, she didn't whine or cry. She sat perfectly on the seat next to my son in his car seat as we went to the vet and back. I own a '14 Ford Fusion and it fit in the seat belt buckle just fine! The seat belt side of this leash is nice and sturdy, I don't think you could bend this one very easily like I've read on reviews of other kinds of belts similar to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: BEST SEATBELT RESTRAINT BY FAR !
customer_reviews.text: Tried a less expensive tether first with exceedingly poor results. My GSD (80 lb and likes to go side to side in back seat) and he broke it first time out. I tried a harness w/seat belt attachment but it was time consuming to put on/take off and he didn't like it at all. This tether is perfect/excellent/a great value. The use of metal vs plastic for the adjustment hardware is great.....once I adjusted the length for him to move side to side it has not had to be readjusted. Also, the carabiner is so easy to quickly clip on/off his collar. It is so easy to use and keeps him safe. I am totally impressed with this tether.
customer_reviews.author: Aloha Lois

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy construction seat belt leash
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a different brand for my dog’s travel harness but I didn’t feel like it was strong or safe. I decided to purchase the Kurgo seat belt connector and I am very happy with it. It is sturdy and has a better clasp to attach to the dog harness. Would buy this again
customer_reviews.author: YC

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Pefect amount of space for my dog. Love that he can ride safely while I drive. Gives him enough room the put his head out the window and not his whole body. Love that I dont have to worry about him possibly getting to daring.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Your family pet will be safe
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this product!!! My dog is spoiled rotten and so she likes to jump into the front seat and stare at the front window. This prevents that from happening. first of all I thought it was going to work by making a slip knot around the actual seat belt, when I looked at it and saw that it actually locks into the seat belt I was happy and pleased. I haven't gotten around to using it with the car seat but I soon will. I'm recommending this to my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Well made, secure
customer_reviews.text: You can certainly get a cheaper dog seat belt, but this one is certainly well made and secure. Clips into my car's female seat belt part. I love how it keeps my dog from exploring in the car/sitting on my lap when I'm driving. Glad I got this. Should have gotten it years ago. Going to get one or two more so I can take all three of my dogs riding at once.
customer_reviews.author: I. Candy

customer_reviews.title: Too Short
customer_reviews.text: My bad. Should have checked if it would work for my dog in my truck. Dog can hardly sit in the seat without choking out. But, it works perfectly as designed. Just wish it would open up another 8 or 10 inches.
customer_reviews.author: ChongYon Fyfe

customer_reviews.title: Works well my smaller dog
customer_reviews.text: So far I haven't experienced any issues with this seatbelt restraint. My dog is small- about 22 lbs, and she is a good back seat driver. She tends to sleep really well on our car rides, which are normally long distance. My only complaint is the length; my dog has, on a few occasions, tried to re-position herself unsuccessfully. In hindsight, if she had been wearing a regular collar she would have been fine. But since I feel more secure with her in her harness, it was more difficult for her to adjust mid trip. Be sure to take that into consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Ward Green

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  It's worth every cent.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend's young beagle, Dexter. Prior to purchasing this Dexter was stuck in a kennel for long hours. Dexter is lucky enough to go to work with his dad everyday, but he grew too big for the kennel and I wanted him to have more freedom. My boyfriend was worried that Dexter would chew through the zipline or damage the seat. But that hasn't happened. Both Dexter and his dad are so happy with this. It was easy to install and easy to use. It keeps Dexter safe and he's so much more comfortable. I'm very happy with this purchase and my boyfriend is a big Fan. Purchase this!
customer_reviews.author: Shykai

customer_reviews.title: Quality and safe
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use in our Polaris Rzr so our dogs can go riding with us. They don’t fit the Rzr perfectly (a bit small and can get stuck easily) but they fit my 4runnner. Good quality and easily adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen in Green

customer_reviews.title: 2,500 mile trip and still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I searched high and low for the best restraint system for our dog as we went on a 2,500 mile road trip. I ended up choosing this system because it seemed to be the most durable. I attached it to the hooks above the backseat doors and used it as a zip line our dog could freely move back and forth. It worked very well except for when our dog would turn around. The leash would get wound up so we would have to unwind it. It wasn't a big deal at all, but it is something to be aware of.
customer_reviews.author: BIPA867

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind for just a few bucks
customer_reviews.text: It's well worth the few dollars, for the peace of mind. Having to hit the brakes hard in a vehicle is enough to send a dog flying. If a collision occurs, assuring that he's either still in the back row of seats or in the zone protected by airbags is essential. This tether at least puts the odds in the pet's favor.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Schultz (ExchangeMaster-dot-com)

customer_reviews.title: Safe a life, don't let a minor car accident kill your dog
customer_reviews.text: Imagine someone rear-ends your car and your dog goes flying through the windshield, killing them (sad I know). Well, with this item you will not have that problem. Also, a more common occurance with my 3 dogs, if I am forced to slam on breaks and they hit the floor board (hurting their legs and scaring them) - not with this! It hooks to the seat belt, which locks up when its yanked on, like it would if you were wearing it. GET ONE!
customer_reviews.author: AnsleyFJ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tether
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my beagles that ride in my car. I also bought the zip line from Kurgo as it gives my dog a little more flexibility to move around in their booster car seat. The material is great and I like the locking carabiner, very secure. The color is nice and it's really heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Chow

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this. Took only a few minutes for my puppy to get adjusted to this (even after being in the car a ton w/o it). I feel so much better knowing he is secured in a seat! Cannot recommend enough!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: My dog wouldn't stay off my lap while I am driving so I bought the Kurgo harness and this seatbelt tether. Works great! I put her in the back seat and she after a few minutes she sat down and quietly looked out the window. I'm going to buy one for each of our cars.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Mong

customer_reviews.title: Great harness and seatbelt for road trips
customer_reviews.text: We have one for each car, the harness comes with one seat belt clip, but we bought another clip so they stay in the car and we can simply put the harness on our dog and go! Great harness and seatbelt for road trips; lets our dog have room to curl up and sleep or move around a bit to sniff the surroundings and get comfortable. It helps that this one is actually crash tested. Gives me peace of mind
customer_reviews.author: Emily S

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product! Works like a zip line!
customer_reviews.text: I wish they would have come out with this when I first got my dog many years ago. This tether is fantastic! Very impressed by the super high quality of it. I attached it to the ceiling handles in the backseat of my pickup for my large dog and it’s like a zip line so he can move back and forth with ease and can’t crawl in the front seat. And it’s a lot safer in case of an accident.
customer_reviews.author: D. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Where has this been all my life!
customer_reviews.text: Solved all my problems!! My dogs always try to get in front seat, this keeps them safe and in place. They don’t get tangled in it and it’s completely adjustable. Snaps right into seatbelt, way easier than putting crate in car.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Great quality, great ease of use. Keeps my 70lb pit bull in the back seat of my car. I feel at ease leaving the window down without fear of her getting hurt, I feel confident she’s a little safer in my car. It also makes it a little easier when I get home and go to take her out of the car. It helped me train her to wait in the car while I said “hold” and grabbed her leash so she wouldn’t just jump out of my car. Great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to secure my dog in the car. Works well for my needs. I already had a Lookout Seat for my other dog so I simply added this tether to it. Now both dogs can sit on the Lookout Seat together. Perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa P

customer_reviews.title: Dogs can unbuckle too, otherwise awesome product
customer_reviews.text: This product is tough and easy to use. My dogs enjoy the car rides much more now that they can relax safely. My only caution is that my Husky figured out accidentally that he can unbuckle himself. He hasn't repeated this, but just know that smart dogs can get around this if they want to.
customer_reviews.author: Hollie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my husky
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic. I have a husky who loves to explore the car and look out the windows when we are driving around. Living in the city, we often have to stop quickly for people cutting lanes. We hook up Koda's harness to the line and she can run back and forth, hang out half open window and if I do slam on breaks she might fall a bit forward but the line catches her and she just ends up landing on the seat. I t completely eliminates the need for me to watch her the whole time. I'd totally recommend it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kate S.

customer_reviews.title: I also like that the clamp can be locked so that it ...
customer_reviews.text: This is heavy duty swivel clamp which is the reason I order this. My male shelties 16 inch at the withers has figured out that if he winds himself around the seat belt then he can pull himself out of the dog seat belt. I also like that the clamp can be locked so that it will not be open up accidentally!!!!! This is a quality product and well made, I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TRR

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my dog secure
customer_reviews.text: My dog would always be stepping in the buckle and getting loose. I have her seatbelted in for safety so she does try to go after anything outside the window or in cause something happens. This has given me piece of mind that she will stay safe for the whole trip.
customer_reviews.author: Alex GTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Excellent addition to a dog car harness
customer_reviews.text: This item was the perfect addition to the Kurgo Tru-Fit Crash Tested Dog Harness. I did not use the tether that came with the harness because it just wrapped around the shoulder strap of the seat belt. My dog would then get tangled in the shoulder strap. With this tether, there is no need to buckle the seatbelt and the shoulder strap is not in the way. Buy a Buckle Boss Seat Belt Guard safety cover for the seat belt clip so your dog will not accidentally release the tether.
customer_reviews.author: Marquis

customer_reviews.title: I love how easy this works when strapping our dog in
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy this works when strapping our dog in. Works great with the harness to provide a safe way to drive with our golden retriever. I just wish it could be a little longer as we have a 75 pound dog and gives her little ability to get in a comfortable position after secured in. We have her get in the car first, get seated the way she wants, and then buckle her in. Once she's buckled in, she can't turn her body around or anything- which I supposed would do the job then if we were in an accident!
customer_reviews.author: KellyAustin

customer_reviews.title: Give me peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: This product gives me peace of mind knowing my dog will be safer while she is riding in the car with me. I use it in combination with a harness & 2 other straps to keep her from going side to side while I am driving. It is a durable & well made product & also keeps my dog from jumping out of my car or trying to get up front with me.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi S

customer_reviews.title: Durable, needs to be a bit longer
customer_reviews.text: My dog rides with me during work and this is great when I need to get into my rig/leave a door open without worrying that my dog will jump out. It locks in perfect with my 05 Excursion. I only wish it was a few inches longer so my dog had a little more wiggle room. Even fully extended, my lab/retriever mix is almost overly restricted on movement.
customer_reviews.author: NEO

customer_reviews.title: Extremely sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my pet's seatbelt, but I also use it as a handle for a strong leash I made out of wire rope. I love how strong it is and feel much better with it attached to my pup in the car. The swivel carabiner is MUCH stronger and more capable of handling the load involved in a car crash than a regular clip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for the Money!
customer_reviews.text: This product works great with a harness. I already had a good harness with a double ring on it. Thank goodness we have never been in an actual crash so I don't know how it would work under those conditions but I've had to stop short a few times where normally my 55 lb. pit/Viszla mix ends up in the foot-well, now he stays safely in the seat and I don't have to worry about trying to stop him with my arm. I really like this if for that fact alone that it keeps my dog secure if I ever have to stop short.
customer_reviews.author: Nyla's Mommy

customer_reviews.title: What this product needs is a pivoting hook in either end like the hooks that come standard with any dog leash
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about this product but there is one flaw with the design that maybe applicable to just my buddy Marshall. You see, Marshall loves to traverse the back seat of my car from the left window to the right. After about 30 minutes of traveling and Marshall traversing, the tether from the zip cord to his harness gets all coiled and tangled up until such time that he can't move. What this product needs is a pivoting hook in either end like the hooks that come standard with any dog leash. If that pivoting hook is designed into this, this will be the perfect product for my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Lovemesomeamazon

customer_reviews.title: Too short and not safe
customer_reviews.text: This seatbelt is way too short for a medium to big size dog. Also, it is unsafe because it keeps unbuckling itself, when the dog walks over it (which is not avoidable). Wouldn’t recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: veronique Bise

customer_reviews.title: When car crating is not possible, you gotta try this.
customer_reviews.text: I have large dogs that want to help me drive the car. This tether clips to the seat belt and their collar. It gives them enough room to sit up (it's adjustable) or lay down but not climb into the driver's seat. If they're in the back, I know they aren't roaming around. They are too large for travel crates and this gives me the satisfaction that they're belted into place when we're driving. Love how easy it is to clip on and off.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Good, does the job, check length before ordering
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Nice materials. Well made Kutgo product. Good - does the job, but could be longer and more adjustable. Be sure to check the length in your car before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: TalkinTexas

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I received the product one day later than a promised date. They can’t explain what happened to the product. Anyhow I received it okay. I immediately installed it to back of my car which is very simple (just like buckling your seat belt). You can make it longer if you would like but I am keeping it shorter. As I get my dog into my car, I just quickly hook to her harness that I already had and that is all you have to do. She can’t escape if we leave our car windows or doors open and can’t come to the deiver’s seat.
customer_reviews.author: Cow girl mom

customer_reviews.title: was a good buy
customer_reviews.text: it's a great seatbelt tether, only thing I wish that was different is that it would swivel but then I dont know how secure that would keep my pup. it does work well and keeps him where you place it until you pup learns too unbuckle themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Putnam

product_meta.title: Kurgo Direct to Seatbelt Tether for Dogs | Car Seat Belt for Pets | Adjustable Dog Safety Belt Leash | Quick & Easy Installation | Works with Any Pet Harness | Carabiner | Swivel | Bungee | Zipline
product_meta.description: Color:Red| Size:1 Pack| Style:Swivel ClipSecure Fido in every vehicle with this heavy-duty dog seatbelt tether with swivel from Kurgo. Working in conjunction with the Tru-Fit smart dog harness, this tether offers the same pet seatbelt security as Kurgo's regular tether, plus easy swivel movement to accommodate dogs that wiggle and move around a lot. It is sure to contain any escape artist pup. This is our strongest tether system, featuring a carabineer used by arborists and a strong, lightweight aluminum hitch. It has been tested to support 20 KkN or 4,500 pounds of force. The swivel action prevents your pup from twisting or getting caught up in the tether. The locking carabineer prevents those sneaky escape artists dogs from getting out of their restraint. Designed to restrain large dogs who never sit still. Includes a 10-inch web loop. Recommend for use with either the Tru-Fit enhanced strength harness 3055 series or 3085 series. Kurgo's award-winning dog travel and outdoor products include everything from crash-tested car harnesses to car seat covers to outdoor products like dog backpacks and boots. LIFETIME WARRANTY: Your satisfaction is important to us. We offer a Kurgo lifetime warranty for products purchased new from authorized sellers. If you have any questions or concerns about our products, please contact Kurgo and we would be happy to assist you!
feature_bullets: SWIVEL FOR EXTRA MOBILITY: Designed for dogs who can't sit still, swivel action prevents pups from getting twisted or caught up in their pet seatbelt tether
PREVENTS DISTRACTED DRIVING: Dog seatbelt keeps your furry friend out of your lap and safely restrained in car back seat
CARABINER ATTACHMENT: Pet seatbelt is designed to restrain large dogs who can't sit still; locking carabiner prevents sneaky escape artist dogs from getting out of their pet seat belt
UNIVERSAL SIZING AND FIT: Includes 10" pet seat belt tether that loops around any car seat belt system
LIFETIME WARRANTY: Product comes with hassle-free Kurgo Lifetime Warranty against manufacturer defects when purchased new from authorized dealer

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
